review: It does its job, most of the time. Cheaper than cable or an Xbox, but glitches a lot! I was very disappointed. The trick is to unplug it as soon as you are done using it then plug it back in before you use it. If you plug it in too early, it won't be discoverable after a while. It's a good product, but would be much better if it could be turned on and off with your phone or laptop ( the same thing that controls what is casted ). Also my roommate says the download is so slow that it can't play movies from her computer (from the Internet) but that could be a problem with her computer or the wifi.
author: Molly

review: This is a great device when I figure  out that you have to keep them powered all the time. One of my TVs keeps the USB connector power all the time and it wasn't having a problem. The other one kills power to the USB port when the TV is off, so I had to power it direct with the power unit provided with the unit. The thing I like about Chromecast is that you can play your content on someone else's Chromcast unit. I purchased the content and I should be able to play it where and when I want. Apple TV has you locked to their device and so when you are at a friends house you are just out of luck playing your content and that is just wrong. If you want to carry your IPAD with you and remote it to the screen that will work, but it is just convenient to use your cell phone to play content when visiting friends.
